english.segment1: God loves a lullaby. In a mothers tears in the dead of night. Better than a Hallelujah sometimes. God loves the drunkards cry, The soldiers plea not to let him die. Better than a Hallelujah sometimes.
english.segment2: We pour out our miseries. God just hears a melody. Beautiful the mess we are. The honest cries of breaking hearts. Are better than a Hallelujah.
english.segment3: The woman holding on for life, The dying man giving up the fight. Are better than a Hallelujah sometimes. The tears of shame for what's been done, The silence when the words won't come. Are better than a Hallelujah sometimes.
english.segment4: Better than a church bell ringing, Better than a choir singing out, singing out.
